whether to run `npm install` or can be options to pass to `dargs` as arguments

Retrieves user's email from Git in the global scope or the project scope
(it'll take what Git will use in the current context)

Retrieves user's name from Git in the global scope or the project scope
(it'll take what Git will use in the current context)
Retrieves GitHub's username from the GitHub API
comment.returns:
Resolved with the GitHub username or rejected if unable to
        get the information

comment.shortText: Receives a list of `components` and an `options` object to install through bower.
comment.text: The installation will automatically run during the run loop `install` phase.
comment.returns: Resolved if install successful, rejected otherwise

comment.text: Options to pass to `dargs` as arguments

comment.shortText:
Runs `npm` and `bower`, in sequence, in the generated directory and prints a
message to let the user know.
comment.returns: Resolved if install successful, rejected otherwise

comment.shortText: Receives a list of `packages` and an `options` object to install through npm.
comment.text: The installation will automatically run during the run loop `install` phase.
comment.returns: Resolved if install successful, rejected otherwise

comment.text: Options to pass to `dargs` as arguments

comment.shortText: Combine package manager cmd line arguments and run the `install` command.
comment.text:
During the `install` step, every command will be scheduled to run once, on the
run loop. This means you can use `Promise.then` to log information, but don't
return it or mix it with `this.async` as it'll dead lock the process.
comment.returns: Resolved if install successful, rejected otherwise

comment.text: Packages to install. Use an empty string for `npm install`
Options to pass to `dargs` as arguments
